pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.2: At that time an association had prepared a meal together with robe-cloth for the Order. They said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.3: “After giving the food, we’ll offer the robe-cloth.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.4: But the monks from the group of six went to that association
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.6: “Sirs, give this robe-cloth to these monks.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.8: We’ve prepared our annual alms-offering together with robe-cloth for the Order.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.9: “The Order has many donors and supporters.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.10: But since these monks are staying here, they depend on you and look to you for support.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.11: If you don’t give to them, who will?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.13: Being pressured by the monks from the group of six, that association gave the prepared robe-cloth to those other monks from the group of six and served the food to the Order.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.14: The monks who knew that a meal together with robe-cloth had been prepared for the Order, but not that the robe-cloth had been given to those monks from the group six, said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.17: The robe-cloth we had prepared were diverted by the monks from the group of six to other monks from the group of six.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.18: The monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.20: “How can the monks from the group of six divert to an individual things they know were intended for the Order?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.21: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.24: Foolish men, how can you divert to an individual things that you know were intended for the Order?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.25: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.26: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:1.1.27: ‘If a monk diverts to an individual something that he knows was intended for the Order, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a complete Order through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.7: he knows by himself or others have told him or the donor has told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.9: given to the Order, given up to the Order.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.11: robe-cloth, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicine; even just bath powder, a toothbrush, or a piece of string.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.1.13: if they have said, “We will give/we will prepare,” and he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.1: If it is intended for the Order and he perceives it as such, and he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.2: If it is intended for the Order, but he is unsure if it is, and he diverts it to an individual, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.3: If it is intended for the Order, but he does not perceives it as such, and he diverts it to an individual, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.4: If it is intended for one Order and he diverts it to another Order or to a shrine, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.5: If it is intended for one shrine and he diverts it to another shrine or to a Order or to an individual, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.6: If it is intended for an individual and he diverts it to another individual or to a Order or to a shrine, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.7: If it is not intended for the Order, but he perceives it as intended for the Order, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.8: If it is not intended for the Order, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.2.9: If it is not intended for the Order and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.3.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.3.4: The twelfth rule, the training rule on diverting, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc82:2.3.5: The eighth sub-chapter on legitimately is finished.
